meanings.definition: A mark or impression made on something by a hand or tool.
meanings.sent1: The artist's handstamps on the clay pottery were unique and easily recognizable.
meanings.sent2: The inspector found handstamps on the document, indicating it had been approved.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child left handstamps all over the freshly painted wall.
meanings.sent4: Her words left a lasting handstamp on his heart, influencing his decisions.
meanings.sent5: The handstamps on the ancient artifact revealed its age and origin.

meanings.definition: A device used to mark the hand with ink for identification purposes.
meanings.sent1: The security guard used handstamps to allow re-entry into the event.
meanings.sent2: The club used handstamps to ensure only paying customers could return later.
meanings.sent3: The handstamp machine malfunctioned, leaving everyone with smudged marks.
meanings.sent4: The handstamps glowed under the UV light, confirming authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The handstamps were a simple yet effective way to control access to the venue.
